text: Light almost clear golden amber color with off white head. Looks delicious. Citrussy and tangerine aroma from the hops I guess, and also some estery fruitiness of apples and pears I think. The malt itself isnt overly present in the aroma but wow it really smells wonderful. The taste is quite sweet and not much bitterness up front but light to medium bitter finish with a little citrussy and grassy hop flavor. All the fruity notes from the aroma can be sensed in the flavor as well. And again not much of the traditional malt flavors especially for a barley wine. It had a fulm body and medium carbonation and a burn from the alcohol can be felt on the palate. I think it is a really great beer. Complex and balanced and quite original in that it is really refreshing in its fresh fruitiness for a barley wine.

From tap at Hair of the Dog, Portland. Aroma is sweet malt, dried fruits, bit candied, ripe fruits, caramel, a touch of hops, with spicy notes. Flavour is rather sweet with a little bitterness in the finish and a boozy liquor touch. Body is full. Sweet and heavy, drinks like a royal shot of spicy liquor. Very nice.

Batch 95. Hazy, orange/copper color with moderate amounts of suspended sediment; no real head to speak of besides a thin white ring. Subtle aroma of sweetnesscandied stone fruits and citrus marmalades; some toffee & chalky hops mixed in, too. Medium-light body; no carbonation; mild warmth from booze. Arrives with a mixture of caramel, stone fruits, and citrus fruits. Boozy, malty middle with chalky hops toward the end. Finish continues with a lot of bitterness but also has tangerine peels lingering. Give it a couple of minutes in the glass, and the bitterness completely dominates. Solid barleywine but falls short in terms of balance.
Aroma is citrus, apple, pearl, caramel, straw and candy sugar Taste is an exceptional mingle of malts and hops. Very well balanced. Slight liquor burn aND biterrness on finish.
On draft at the source. Pours cloudy brownish gold with no head. Caramel and confectioners sugar, paper, low carbonation, light body. Astringent finish.

Originally rated on 2/7/09. My only gripe about this was the carbonation, upon pouring (very, very slowly) i had a pint glass full of foam with 1 inch of beer. It took forever for it to finish pouring the glass and i ended up only getting about 8 oz. out of each of my bottles (2). Other than that it was pretty good. Aroma and flavors of sweet malts, dark fruit, pine and floral notes from the hops. Overall it was nicely balanced, not too sweet or bitter, good complex flavors, and it was easy to drink. A bit pricey but it was worth a try. Batch #73

Golden apricot color with white foamy head. Lively bubbles rising to the top. Aroma of caramel, rye, brown sugar, malts, small fruity notes. Sweet, boozy, numbs the toungue. Tangerine from the rye. A bit too boozy.

Draught at Hair of the Dog. Hazy amber color, white head. Bittersweet taste with citrus, ripe fruits, peach, resin, a bit of hops, pine and earthy notes. Bittersweet finish with citrus, hops, peach, resin, earthy notes and a bit of alcohol. Excellent brew, a kind of a mixture of barley wine and Belgian strong ale.
Klares goldorange mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, süß, zuckerig, leicht fruchtig, etwas Orangenschale, Pinie, harzig.
On tap at ACBF2017. Pours hazy orange, white head. Sweet, caramel, malty, dried fruit, raisins, hops, spicy. Some bitterness in finish. Warming. Smooth and full bodied.

A: Clear brown coloured with a two finger white head N: Liqourice, caramel, toffee, fudge T: Fudge, toffee, caramel, hint of grape zest O: normally not really fond of barley wine, but this is actually really nice!
Pomiędzy Triplem a utlenionym na miodowo IIPA. Całkiem spora goryczka, sporo miłej, owocowo-przyprawowej słodyczy. Fajne.

From Mikkeller Shop. In Teku glass. Batch 96. Playing Shantae Pirates Curse. Pretty alcoholic and sweet. However, its not unpleasant but just the opposite thanks to a good usage of candi sugar and hops. Sticky and oily
Butelka, bottlesharing w Piwotece. Taka wypadkowa DIPA i BW. Sporo chmielu, ale też przyjemnie słodkie i gładkie. Fajne.

Sampled at ACBF 2017, Vichte. Clear golden pour with a thin fine-grained off-white head. Notes of citrus hops, bitter hops, dried fruit, caramel, soft alcohol. Feels more like a triple IPA than a barleywine, but I am not complaining!

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2017 ACBF2017. Barwa pomara?czowo ?ó?ta, piana jest bia?a do?? trwa?a i podobnie wysoka.Aromat slodowy, s?odki, oowcowySmak nie odbiega od tego co oferuje aromat, jest s?odowo??, s?odkie owoce. Slodycz kontruje dluga i mocna, owocowa goryczka.Piwo jest pe?ne, grube.

Sampled @ ACBF Vichte 2017. Klare orange goldene Farbe, mittelgroße beige Schaumkrone. Geruch ist kräftig malzig, sehr hopfig, Harz. Geschmack ist kräftig malzig, sehr fruchtig hopfig, dezent süß, lecker.

12 oz. Bottle BATCH 89 from KL&wine merchants Redwood City: pours slightly haze orange like deep amber with off-white small foamy head. Aroma-flavors: toasted toffee, hint of caramel, honey like sticky sweetness, apricot, peppery spiciness, citrusy, tropical fruits like gentle hop profile, rum-like sweet alcohol note. Body is full, texture soft, carbonation is moderate.
Aromas a malta, sabor a pan, higos secos, canela. Cuerpo medio alto y un final muy persistente.
Aromas y sabor higo, canela, mazapán, piel de naranja. En boca tiene cuerpo denso y final seco largo casi astringente.

Butelka. Barwa bursztynowa, metna. Piana trwała, średniej wysokości. Aromat średnio intensywny. Karmel, świeże owoce (brzoskwinia), rodzynki, przyprawy, lekka nuta alko.. W smak umiarkowana slodycz. Kandydowany cukier, lekki karmel, rodzyni, morele. Nie przyjemnie zalegajacy alkohol, męczące pod koniec. 

Zaszeregowanie tego piwa do BW to wg. Mnie nadużycie.

Bottle from mikkeller web shop. Bath #96. Cloudy somewhat murky appearance. Color is gold to orange. Head is thin and white. Medium to high bitterness, medium sweetness. Medium and warm body. Long dry and tasty finish. Aroma is spices, hops, caramel, vanilla, peach. Flavour is pine, resin, caramel, spices. Great beer.

(355ml bottle from Mikkeller Webshop) Pours a clear dark amber with a huge fine beige head that fades to a cap with chunks of lace. Aroma of honeyed malts with light caramelized touches, nutty faintly toasted grain, orange marmalade, golden raisins, preserved pale pit fruits, dried grass and herbs, light peppery spiciness. Flavour is quite sweet dark honey, demerara sugar, light caramel, lots of dried fruit, especially golden raisins, citrus fruit and apricots, lots of marmalade too, peppery spicy notes, hoppy and herbal, finishing quite dry with fairly high, spicy hop bitterness, resin and citrus, and some alcohol heat, lightly astringent. Medium bodied with soft filling carbonation, booze not totally hidden. Nice, fruity and spicy pale barley wine, sweet but not cloying or overwhelming.

Hazy orange color with off-white head. Aroma has sweet malt, candied oranges, peaches, apricots and a light nutty note. Taste has also sugar notes, not so fruity as the aroma suggested but the nutty note is present on the finish. Body is medium to full and has a smooth feel. Slight alcohol heat and medium bitterness on the aftertaste. Overall it has really nice flavors but the alcohol heats your insides a bit too much.

Bottle.Dark golden colour with almost no head.Aroma is fruity of dried fruits and marmalade,even good nots of spices and herbs,hoppy and livley and good mild sweet finish overall very nice beer with good full body.

Köszönet érte Lore-nak! Nem mindennapi főzde palackjára esett a választásom a 700. sörpontozás alkalmával, egy Hair of the Dog levadászása régóta a bakancslistámon szerepelt már. Ennek megfelelően nemigen tudnék rossz véleményt kipréselni magamból Freddel kapcsolatban, de mint ahogy az lenni szokott, ez esetben sem kell kozmetikáznom az értékelésen. Kinézete magával ragadó, opálos és sűrű, élettel telt, narancslekvár-küllem, tojáshéj színű, pöffeszkedő krémhabbal a tetején. Süteménytésztás, marcipánmasszás, grapefruit-dzsemes, vérnarancsos, virágszirmos illatai szambát járnak, az aromás komlók színes együttese húzza a nótájukat. Haraphatóan teltek az ízjegyek, vibrálnak a trópusi gyümölcsös töltelékkel megkent piskótatésztás, marmaládés, diós színezetű, cifra élesztős, kandiscukorral megszórt elemek, melyek egyrészt belga beütésűek, mégis a vérbeli amerikai vonal megtestesítői. Sziporkázó stílusegyveleg, mely majdnem annyira IPA, mint amennyire barley wine, a mázsás súlyú karakter, a szirupos malátafolyam hömpölygése azonban valóban az utóbbi típus stílusjegyeinek irányába mutatnak. Egy ilyen főzet után már csak arra lennék kíváncsi, milyenek lehetnek a Hair of the Dog egyéb, nagynevű alkotásai.

How: Draught.
Where: Omnipollos hatt, Stockholm.
Appearance: Hazy dark golden colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Caramel, dried fruit, raisin, plum, citrus, malt.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Sweet malt, dried fruit, raisin, alcohol.

Sweet fruity and malty with a plethora of dried fruit, caramel, treacle, winter spices, gorgeous stuff.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear dark golden, thick offwhite head. Malty aroma, fruity with caramel and hops. Malty flavour, notes of vanilla and dried fruit. Quite fruity beneath the hoppy, slightly alcoholic bitterness. Bittersweet with a nicely rough finish.

Bottle (from mikkeller webshop). Pours amber with whiteish head. Aroma is sweet, candy, alcohol, malt, condensed milk. Flavor is sweet and bitter, candy, malt, alcohol, some bitterness. Finish is dry bitter with booze. Overall: ok, bit too boozy.

Bottle shared by Mart, thanks! Hazy orange beer, white head. Nose is sweet, yeasty notes, thick malt, orange notes. Flavor is yeast, thick caramel sweetness, toasty notes, vanilla and dried fruit. Resiny hops in the finish. Big and thick, chewy.

12fl oz bottle (thanks Mart). Clear amber color. Small size, white head, stays. Sweet, fruity, caramel, toffee, alcohol in aroma. Sweet, fruity, caramel, hops and bit of toffee in taste. Toffee and caramel and alcohol in aftertaste. Very solid brew.

Hazy ora ge colour, one inch creamy yellowish off-white head; aroma of grapefruit, biscuit, caramel, vanilla and dried fruity-raisin-ish notes; taste is the same with dry white wine and herbal notes, as well as intensive hoppy bitterness and spicy aftertaste; great barley wine
On tap at the brewery. Appearance is orange/yellow with a small white head. Aroma is caramel and fruity. Taste follows nose.

Un liquide bien orangé et trouble coule lourdement dans mon verre. Aucune mousse ne se forme et je me demande si je verse le liquide correctement. Je verse donc la seconde moitié de la bouteille vigoureusement. Rien. Cette bière ne présente vraiment aucune mousse. Enfin. Des arômes riches et amples de pomme rouge compotée, de pâte à tarte,de houblons américains qui ne cherchent pas à envahir le palais mais à balancer cette riche base maltée; mission quils accomplissent avec succès, faut-i le mentionner. Un abricot séché me fait également honneur de sa présence. En bouche, le liquide propose un corps plus quappréciable. Sans être ni trop sucré, mon palais détecte une texture satinée alors que mon oesophage trouve la descente plutôt râpeuse. Cette dernière caractéristique ne provient à mon avis pas du sucre présent, mais plutôt dune amertume surpuissante attribuable à une impressionnante quantité de houblons en début de boil. Cest vraiment très amer! Malts balancés et épicés, un vin dorge dété comme dhiver.
Brown. Thin white head. Brown sugar. Plum. Really well done. Tasted at HOTD w joey.
Served on tap. Standout beer. Heavier beer, coats your mouth, and good dose of hops. A beer meant to be sipped and enjoyed. Definitely lingers on the palate.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tulip. Beautiful shade of amber-orange, slightly hazy, and has a thick, tall, tan head. Nose of caramel and bread. Taste is medium sweet with a long bitter finish. Hint of some alcohol warmth. Carbonation is made up of an abundance of tiny bubbles, but is left with a soft and creamy feel. Slightly sticky on the lips.

Bottle thanks to my friend Kyle for bringing one back. Poured thick hazy orange with no head. Aroma sweet resinous malt fruit syrup. Light carb med bod. Taste sweet light bitter malt juice. Hop resins lingers around too much
Bottle. Pours hazy dark golden color. Aroma and taste are lots of bitter malts, caramel, and some dark fruits.

Bottle from brewery. Pours golden hazy with thin off-white head. Aroma is sweet malty boozy. Taste is sweet malty with hits of caramel and bread with a boozy finish. Pretty good. Not my favorite style but very solid.

Hair of the Dog, Portland. Bright, clean gold with pretty white foam. Hazy yeast, full sweet mouth. Perfect balance of cream, alcohol and yeast. Just a terrific, landmark beer. Great bread, a touch lactic and full rich alcohol.
Bottle from K&L Wine Merchants in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is strong fruit (apple, pear) and caramel. A tad sweet but incredible mouthfeel and the right amount of rye and hoppy bitterness.
Tap @ Borefts 15. Notes from then: Sweet! Lots of candy notes. Syrup. Like it a lot!

Tasted from bottle. Pours a murky dark orange with white head. Nice strong aroma is brown sugar, caramel, some fruits. Taste is moderate to heavily sweet with a little alcohol burn. Flavors of brown sugar, biscuits, toffee, caramel, dark fruits. Big tasty beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very great beer, plenty of flavour and aroma to raw grain, brown sugar, biscuit and a slight bitter hint, which balances to the perfection.

Rating #1677 - #CBC2015 - Beer 62 - On tap at HOTD w/ Ferris. Hazy brassy coloured pour, bubbly head, not much lacing. Aroma is sweet sweet citrus and honey - mango, peach, vanilla. Taste is an alcoholic hoppy punch, lots of IBUs tempered with sweetness, and a ton of alcohol on the palate, but not thoroughly undisguised. Just a big bold beer for flavour-lovers. Awesome.

Hair of the Dog Fred on tap at Imazato. A mellow brassy gold. A juicy fresh orange citrus aroma easily to confuse with an IPA. The taste is malty and gives a sort of caramel spread and orange blossoms flavor. After the hoppy bouquet the more malt forward flavor caught me by surprise. This is a damn solid beer and in no way reveals its huge 10% ABV. Had some in a snifter and it totally boosted the taste.

On tap at Imazato. Poured a bright orange gold, pretty clear. A difficult aroma to pin down, lots going on - dense hop mix, floral, strong grassy and earthy notes. Nothing feels out of place not overpowering. The flavour gives a sharp booze feel with a tonne of citrus, kind of like a liqueur, but this is carried by a medium body with an effervescent feel. Interesting stuff. A sipper, with plenty of flavour to take in. We all shared a glass of the start of the tap, which was filled with sediment, very cloudy, and it had a remarkable funky yeast, rye, and hop aroma. Makes me wanna try a bottle so I can measure my pour to mix some of this in.
Aged for at least 3 years. pours clear golden with thin white head, it has big bready aroma with hint of spice. it tastes medium sweet, sour, and finishes bitter. full bodied.
On tap at the brewery. Aroma is a ton of peach. Taste is peach and pine. Finish is bitter. Mouthfeel is slightly sticky.

Bottle from el cerrito market and liquor. Copper color with almost no head. Aroma has sweet caramel notes, suryp, sugar, plums. Low carb, very sweet, caramel, raisins, suryp. Little carbonation would make this better.

Bottle 0.33l at The Halloween tasting 2015 Belgrade Serbia.Taste at Beerville Bar with our small tasting group.Bro Vlada, Bro Alberto and Bro Matt.Bottle from luttonm thanks.Pour it hazy orange color with no head.Aroma fruity, alcohol and liquorice. Taste of peppery note, molasses, apricot jam, elegant nice finish, some bitter note on the end also.Bravo.

Hair of the Dogs classic barley wine commemorating the late Fred Eckhardt, Portlands influential beer author. Loose, egg-white, irregular head needing some forcing to form but well retaining after that, beautiful deep and pure amber colour, clear with a small flake of protein here and there initially but many more of those with deposit, rendering the beer cloudy dark orange. Powerful and somewhat unusual bouquet of blood orange, grapefruit, mango, freshly toasted bread, watermelon, dried banana, vanilla, pink pepper, white port wine, cider, pear brandy, caramel, chlorine-like hint and even something diary-like (buttermilk - diacetyl?), but in all very agreeable. Candied sweet onset, marmelade, melon, papaja, canned apricot, some sourish berries, citrus peel freshness, expectedly soft carbonation, slick, oily and supple mouthfeel, thick caramel malt sweetness, honeyish, rich with a bitterish toasted edge for balance especially in the finish as well as a certain rye bread-like deep sourishness, where it is accompanied by peppery hops with a brief but unmistakable sharpish American sting and retronasal floral and citrus aromas but quite mildly so yet very complex (unsurprisingly seen the amount of hop varieties used), as well as the expected glow of white rhum-like alcohol, becoming just a little bit wry in the end but not disturbingly so especially considering this particular beer style. The big caramel malt sweetness triumphs in the end but remains well balanced by the bittering hops.  Delicious sipper with certain Belgian traits, mostly sweet but in an elegant, seductive manner and well-balanced with bitterish hop and toasted notes. I wonder what this would taste like with some mild maderisation after several years of cellaring...  Expensive, but Im glad I bought this. Hair of the Dog rarely disappoints!

Potent stuff. Lots of caramelized barley. Candied apple and booze with some very sweet tangerine. Pours cloudy orange without much head. Lots of sediment floating around. Very sweet finish. Slightly syrupy consistency. Bottle my dad sent me from brewery.

At the Belgrade-Serbia tasting on 31/10/2015. Bottle courtesy of luttonm, many thanks. Pours light amber color, hazy with sediments in the glass, almost no head. Nose: sweet, peach, apricot, sweet fruit jam. Amazing. Mouth: sweet yellow fruit molasses, orange marmalade, bitter elegant finish. Rich peculiar beer.
Light brown. Clear. Flavour is extremely malty. Lots of bread and fruity sugars too.
Kleur tussen oranje en koper in. Geen schuim. Jammer. Geur als quadrupel, barley wine. Met peer, sinaasappel. Niet echt mijn smaak. Ziet, carbo, en iets geks...

Tap at Craftheads. Blonde. Wow, lovely taste. Rounded, booze is there but hidden. Very smooth. Grainy, but sweet, orchard fruit, sticky sweetness. Treacle/golden syrup. Very easy drinking. Lovely stuff.
Drank @ Borefts 2015 (saturday).Seeet beer, lots of taste. Very rich. Barley and malt come to mind.

On tap @ Borefts 2015, De Molen Bodegraven - NL. Color: clear amber beer with no carbonation and no foam. Smell: barley and malt domination, small sweet alcohol finish. Taste: full body and very oily sensation. Nice sweet malt taste and cereal. Very sweet finish. Aftertaste: alcohol domination and sweet cereal finish.

sample from draft at borefts 15. poured a slight cloudy golden colour with a white head. nose has buttery notes, barley, and sticky caramel. raisins, and caramel malts aswell. prunes, slight bitter hop bitterness finish.
At Borefts 2015. Aroma of bitter raisin and caramel. Flavor is of a typical bitter us barley wine, so raisin, caramel and malt. Nice, but nothing spectacular.
Draught at BBF15. Pale amber with a small white head. Full body with low carbonation. Quite sweet with subtle bitter tones. Caramel, ripe fruits and some spices. Tasty barley wine!
Keg at borefts. Pours hazy amber, nose is sweet toffee, fruity, taste is really juicy fruit, dry toffee, caramel.

15cl taster at Borefts Bier Festival, Bodegraven. Slightly cloudy golden colour, slim offwhite foamy head. Big malty ale, rye easily noticeable, orange peel, faint Porto tones. Big body, lively carbonation.
Bottle. Orange colour with white head. Caramel, hoppy, yeast aroma. Sweet, bitter, hoppy, caramel, yeast taste. Medium to full body.

12 oz. bottle thanks to Willrunforbeer. Batch 93 on the label. Amber / gold without zero head. Lots of bottle conditioned yeast and sediment floating in the glass.The aroma is sugar, caramel, sugar, raisins and sugar. Did I mention sugar?? 
The texture of this beer is very syrupy and just a blast of sugar in the finish. Dark fruit hints. But again the dark fruit is covered in sugar. Did I forget to mention sugar is in this brew?  I guess I am missing something with this barley wine? Its like diabetes in a glass.

Poured from bottle batch 93 thanks Willrunforbeer. Pours murky golden orange with no head. Aromas of straight up sweet caramel and and brown sugar. Taste is sweet cough syrup caramel and brown sugar. Not so good.
12oz bottle, batch 93. Pours orange brown with no head. Aroma is caramel, light grains, brown sugar, molasses. This is super sweet, caramel, brown sugar... Too sweet.

12fl.oz. bottle. (Batch #94) Pours a murky, golden orange with a very thin, fully diminishing, off-white head and plenty of sediment. Sweet aroma of caramel malt, fruit, wood, alcohol and a hint of spice. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, sugar, fruit, wood and spice with a dry, bitter, hoppy, warming alcohol finish. Medium body with a thick, oily texture and flat carbonation.

Tap pour into 12 oz tulip at the brewery. Seriously love this place. Beautiful orange color with golden hints. Cloudy with some impressive lacing. Aroma is big with citrus taking center stage. Good spice quality too. The taste is...I mean...its just...so ridiculously good. Sugars and malt are prevalent but its balanced so well with the rye grains and a little bitterness. Perfect balance. This is one of my favorites in Portland.
Damn! Bought 2 years ago in San Diego. Huge hop presence in the aroma. Fruity, malty, hoppy with subtle dark brown sugar and dark fruits. This beer is magical.

Appearance: absolutely flat; syrupy golden orange; small pour into a mini-goblet so as to properly decant, given there appeared to be a quarter inch of sediment in the bottle.  Aroma: blast of syrupy vanilla, caramel, orange, slightly turned milk, and burnt cardboard.  Taste: 	cloyingly sweet, with a powerful taste of werthers original candy (because my grandsons special, too), creamed corn, apricot, bourbon, vanilla, and powdered non-dairy creamer.  Finish: lingering heat and sweetness, with that slightly rancid milk note coming out to play. Notes: This was bloody awful. Batch 92.

Pours hazy orange/brown with no head. AROMA: malty, sweet citrus, spice, caramel, floral hops, boozy, herbs, earthy, orange, white wine and light pine. TASTE: malty, citrus, herbal hop bitterness, spice, pine, pineapple, light booze, caramel, herbs, white table wine, leaves, alcohol, very light licorice and orange. AFTER TASTE: malty, spice hop bitter and citrus with an oily sweet boozy finish.

12oz bottle. Orange Amber color. Fruit toffee caramel banana aroma. Thick texture that coats the mouth. Malt raisin alcohol and sugar flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2009 vintage. Pours hazy golden with a white head. The aroma has candi sugar, light spice and Belgium abbey yeast. It has a full rich body with semi-soft carbonation and is pretty smooth. The flavor starts off very sweet with light toast and a bit of spice, pepper and caramel.
Bottle - Vintage 2000 - Caramel, candy notes and oxidized sweetness. Cloudy gold with a decent beige head. Sweet, caramel, bitterness, raisin and a nice oxidized sweetness.

355ml bottle enjoyed @ my vacation apartment. Pours murky golden with a tiny white head. Lots of floaties. Aroma is floral, earthy, caramel, toffee, mild resin, alcohol, hops. Full bodied, thick texture, no carbonation.

Batch 92 (2013) drank late 2014. Same time as a batch 36 (2001)

Batch 92 8-4-8-3-17

Light gold with fully lasting rocky head, some floaters. Aroma is floral, light fruit, almost citrus. Flavor carries on, dense preserved citrus, densly bitter, basically an IIPA. Feel is lively, thick, hot, and woody.

Batch 36 - 2001 - 9-3-7-4-16

Red gold, still, crystal clear like Amaro. Aroma of very deep honey, apple, aa little wood. Taste is very dense bitter, decayed malts, near cloying sweets. Viscous feel, wood, astringent, heat. Aroma has concentrated beautifully. The flavor hasnt.
Bottle at home, batch 92. Pours amber golden with almost no head. Aroma: sweet honey. Taste is sweet malty honey with bitter aftertaste. Tastes almost like mead. Nice!
Bottle. Pours hazy golden brown with no head. Nose is vanilla, caramel and bourbon. Taste is sugar and vanilla. Lots of alcohol in the taste.

3 oz pour into a stemmed tasting glass from tap at the brewery in Portland. Deep orange and a tiny bit hazy with a strong white head and good lacing. Full bodied. A little sharp. Nose is surprisingly weak compared to what I would have expected. Sweet and malty up front. Assringent candy sweet in the middle and a strange aggressive bitterness that lingers. Too much of a bitter and sweet clash for me. The sweetness is just as aggressive as the bitterness and they dont meld well.

Tap at brewery with commonmac and rosskyle and wildcard. 12oz pour in tulip. Light copper with thick foamy white head. Strong aroma of sugar and alcohol. nice nose. Strong sugar taste throughout. Aggressive and bold. A bit of funky sour dark fruit. Well done.

Bottle pour split, with Andrew, tried along with the Fred from the wood, thin amber pour, this is batch #92 got this at the Brewery probably about a year ago. Sweet raisin taste little hop taste, really enjoyed this one, probably a tad bit more than the Fred from the wood.

12 oz bottle poured, shared, and enjoyed side by side for comparison with Fred from the Wood. Fred batch no. 92. Pours a thick, cloudy burnt orange color with a super sweet brown sugar aroma. Smooth, sweet sugary flavor with some caramel and cinnamon spice. Candy finish. Very nice beer, and in my opinion, definitely one of a kind. Fun comparison too, but Ill explain that on a different beer rating.

Pretty good. Called a golden strong ale but with the Belgian candied sugar I would say it's a hell of a triple. Boozey as hell but drinkable. Not too sweet. A little astringent but a great beer to sip on. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Had on tap at the source. $4.75 for the full pint. Score. Tastes and smells of rye bread, burnt cotton, candied sugar, vanilla wafers, and grassy hops. Bites so good.

Great beer but a bit tough to handle. It is very boozy. Lots of stone fruit and rich brown sugars. Great aroma and taste is good, but man it is potent ethanol notes. Id like to think you should let this one sit.

Batch 93. Poured a deep golden color, completely still. No carb. Aroma was fruity hop, caramel, butterscotch, mild resin notes. Flavors were slightly sweet with nice fruit presence, more caramel, complex boozy notes. Lots going on. Long fruity caramel finish that lingers with a nice bitterness. Mouthfeel was slick and oily, almost mead like. Flavors were outstanding and one of a kind but total lack of carbonation hurt the experience quite a bit. Would love to try a different batch and re rate.

Poured form 12 fl oz bottle [batch 93]. Orange with no head whatsoever and a bit of sediment. Aroma of caramel, fruit, and alcohol, mild hops. Taste is fairly sweet with an alcohol kick and becomes a resiny grapefruit hop finish. Subtle oily texture.

Pour is a murky, sickly looking brown with no head at all. Aroma is butterscotch, brown sugar and raisons. Flavor is some rye spice to start, then comes some brown sugar and a baked apricot with other various dark fruits. Finish is a bit of alcohol warmth with candi sugar all over the place. A very slow sipper for sure. Not an everyday beer but one of those well known beers you have to try at least once. Full of dark fruit and sugary goodness.

Great beer, too sweet, then it was warmer, then it was better, then it was great. Lost my stinkin review to the gawdamn server...or something. Too bad, it was awesome. Good beer, thanks to Hair of the Dog.  Im a little bit furious.
(tap) Extremely bitter. Apricot and other citrus flavors. Im not really a fan. Oh well.
Orange gold pour, fruity aroma. Flavor is rich and fruity with lots of toffee, roast, raisins and dates.

Bottle from 2007. Pours hazy dark muddy brown with no head. Aromas of caramel, fainted hops, dark jam, light salmiak, heavy malt, dark ripe fruits. Taste is malty, caramel, faded hops, raisins, dates, bitter licorice-like finish. Such a good balance!

Bottle. Batch 69. Pours dark hazy amber, slight sediment in bottom, beige foamy ring along side off the glass. Feels heavy in the glass. Aroma is sweet. Some oxidation, but in the nice way. Bit jammy, old fainted hops, malts, raisins, bread, slight port alcohol. Taste is sweet, but then turns bitter. Loads of raisins, caramel, toasty, slight warming but pleasant booze. Sugary sticky feel. Lack of carbonation. Quite dry finish. Hops suits this beer really well.

33cl bottle from anctient times (2007). Pours a greasy, unclear amber with a tiny, oily, off white head. Aroma has lots of caramel malts, dusty earth, vanilla, slight port wine, slight heavy, jammy acid and sugary sweetness, old hops. Taste is very nicely balanced. Lots of raisins, prunes, ripe plums. Very sweet and heavy, but gets some hints of licorice. Nice hoppyness with a hint of bitterness, though its not very much. Lots of toffee and caramel. Extremely heavy body and an almost non-existing carbonation. Good stuff!
2010 bottle. Pours a cloudy copper with small off white head. The aroma is dark fruit and caramel. Thin mouthfeel, candy sugar, caramel, raisin, boozy finish, very nice.

Bottle split a few ways. Batch 69 bottled september 07. Light hazy golden pour with no head. Some slight notes of oxidization, some light tartness, prett sweet, vanilla and caramel. Good stuff and pretty easy drinkable!
Bottle. Amber with white head. Aroma of sultanas, dried fruit, caramel. Taste of dried fruit, apricot, sultana, fig. Slightly bitter. Tasty

Yikes! I should have read up on this before drinking so it would not have been such a shock. Cloudy red pour, no head at all. Thick, viscous, super sweet, almost no detectable carbonation. Aroma of burnt sugar and concentrated pineapple. Sweet, orange-pineapple flavor, some bitterness, reminded me of orange marmalade. Very light and bitter finish. Absence of carbonation made the sweet go out of control. Not my style, not my thing.

Tap sampler at brewery. Nice head, killer lace, cloudy cider colored body. Aroma is fruity and juicy. Taste is sweet and juicy, apple and citrus, some banana, rich resin. Palate is thicker than it looks, finish is bitter hops. Nice balance between sweet and bitter, even though is almost too sweet for me.

Bottle (12oz $6) Batch #93. Cloudy reddish brown. Zero head. No lacing. Sweet smell. Taste may be ok if the mouth feel was any good. This is the second bottle I have had and it is just as bad this time. No carbonation, just tastes like drinking syrup. I have one more bottle which I will sit on for a long while to see if it improves. Interestingly, my previous rating was deleted.

Bottle during (mostly) Hair of the Dog beers tasting. Many thanks again Jef!
Batch #78 side by side with batch #82
#78 = 3,5
APPEARANCE: clouded blond beer, almost no head. 
NOSE: alcohol, fruity, esters, butter.
TASTE: alcohol, fruity, esters, butter, unbalanced and flat.
#82. = 3,8
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: fruity, alcohol, nice, hoppy, florar.
TASTE: hoppy, dry, florar, alcohol.
Two completely different beers, one probably was not cellared properly

Bottle from a trade, @ HOTD tasting 2014. Soft carbonation. Dark brown colour, thin layer of dark brown foam. Complex aroma of dark fruit, caramel, toffee, citrus and brown sugar. Light notes of vanilla. Bitter hoppy finish.

Batch 78 bottle from HOTB. Pours a murky reddish brown with zer head whatsoever. Aromas of dark fruits caramel molasses brown sugar. Taste is sweet and raisiny. Some alcohol heat. Medium light body. Super low carb.
Tap at Hair of the Dog. Pours hazy orange with white head. Aroma is very caramel, barley, sweet. Taste is nicely balanced, a hoppy barley wine, easy, smooth, low carbonation. Overall, very good.

Pours a cloudy brown and without any head whatsoever. Biscuit, caramel, toffee, citrus, resinous hop and malt aroma. Resinous hop, citrus, caramel, fig, biscuit, toffee, alcohol, oxidation and malt flavors. Bitter but completely flat and very oxidized. Boozy and bitter biscuit finish. Hope this was just a bad bottle that was improperly capped but for the price for a bottle not sure if worth getting again. Definitely infected. Batch 93

From notes:
Had this on draft at hair of the dog brewery. Reddish with white head. Smells like a pile of prunes. Tastes pretty good.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2014 On tap, poured into a sampler tulip. Aromatics containing bread crust and dry citrus / curcao are dominant with some hints of sugar and mango. It pours a hazy and murky orange color with a white, dense foam head that reduces to a thin ring with a light fuzz surface. It leaves a a few streaks of dense, microbubble lace. The taste is a medium high sweet, medium bitter, and a touch of sour. An abundant, soft, creamy carbonation accompanies the full body, viscous texture. Sweet caramel, bread crust, and tropical fruit flavors start the mouth, and it turns to bitter fruit at the finish with a bit of a sour touch. A mellow bitterness and pine linger in the aftertaste.

"this one was originally a little harsh for me (05). Had some of the same qualities as Bigfoot (good) and Arrogant Bastard (which I also find to be a little harsh), though. deep and complex, but Ill most likely spend my money elsewhere, especially for the price. 3/11 - after a couple years, gave it another shot. better. i saw someone described it as a Hardys meets Bigfoot. Not as sweet as hardys or as bitter as bigfoot, but definitely a little of both. it grew on me with each sip. fruity. alcohol still a tad too prevelant, but the warmth at the swallow cancels out the overcarbonation. well done. still not a 99th percentile beer (100th on rb) in my mind, but quite good. originally a 3.8 or so...batch 80 4.3...average 4.1

Fred is a very sweet beer with high alcohol content. Aroma notes include cereal, citrus, and sweet corn. Appearance is golden in color, liquid is clear, and the head is white foam and medium frothy. Taste is medium to heavy sweetness with no bitterness. Body is medium with a creamy texture on the tongue. Average level of carbonation and a short, sugary finish. Overall, this beer is much too sweet for my taste and I would not buy it again.

12oz bottle - pours a hazy yellow , thick fluffy head . Aromatic hop aroma . Taste is slightly sweet but has a nice piney hop note . Finishes a little boozy but otherwise delicious . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

STEVE!! Thanks! A couple of bottles from the source, cellar aged 14 months and split with ck1 & Jan. Lighter than expected pour. Very fruity, barleywine-ish, caramel/butterscotch-y. Similar to Bourbon Fred but not as super sweet. 14.2

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours hazy dark amber with a lot of sediment and an off-white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are caramel, alcohol, dried fruit, orange rind, and hops - with a bitter and alcoholic finish.

Pour with thick rich head and big malty rye aroma. The flavor was so big and rich, yah needed a fork and knife to cut through it. Absolutly big wonderful beer for the tastebuds. Great hop usage to balance it out. Great finish with added warmth to put this over top.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Youll know what youre getting into at first whiff. Malts and alcohol greet you, a murky copper color with just a ring of head around the glass. Some caramel/ toffee sweetness mellows the whole thing. Alcohol burn and warmth all the way down.
good brew; didnt seem like a barley wine to me. raisins and yeast in aroma and taste... ok, but I dont see the fuss..

Bottled sample via and shared with oakbluff. Clear amber in colour with medium carbonation and virtually no head. Aromas are of dried apricot, toffee, booze, licorice, and earth. A bit of sherry on the palate, along with white pepper, and spicy grain. This bottle had a few years on it, but was still a bit hot. OK.
Pretty boozy and sweet aroma. Taste was a bit different for me. Almost to dry. Mouthfeel wasn't exactly for me.

Bottle to snifter
Aroma of Scottish tablet, pepper, wheat, and raisin. Pours with a massive frothy off white head that peters away fairly quickly to a think frothy head, but leaving a large amount of lacing. The beer is a somewhat cloudy reddish amber. Taste is alcohol, orange, rye, and malts with a strong bitter ending. Very strong.

On tap at the brewery -- copper & opaque, head fades off and leaves lacing, no residual head (collar). Kind of weird, super-strong taste (alcohol) and aftertaste (rye). Yeah this beer is weird just like their other beers, but better. Why do they love rye so much? The candi sugar muddles the waters a bit...the rye is interesting as well, points for originality but a little lacking in execution. Get your mouth ready, so to speak.

I went to the brewery to taste this highly rated beer. For $9 a bottle! it was a huge dissapointment. Highly overrated. Flat chocolate drink with alcohol. Typically American overblown beer with any lack of subtlety. The micro brews have brought a new beer culture to the US, but as with most things it is overdone and lacks balance. No comparison with the Belgian abby beers.
Tasty. Cloudy dirty golden pour toffee and dark fruit aroma. Sweet toffee nice floral hops some caramel. Lively carbonation moderate body. Tasty.

Batch 90 consumed on 8/6/14. Hazy light orange/copper pour with loose head. Sweet aroma of caramel and raisin and a taste to match. The alcohol is hidden well, but the palate was a bit too heavily carbonated and fizzy. Not my favorite style, but I liked it more than most barleywines (which seems the best category for this beer).

Pours a deep cloudy gold with minimal head. Aroma of plumb and maple. The taste is sweet with a stiff bitterness that follows the alcohol burn. Fruit notes rise as the bitterness fades. Mouthfeel is thick and smooth. The strength of the beer is not masked that well. Thanks to BrAd for bringing me back a Fred. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ Hair of the Dog, Portland. Pours hazy golden with a big creamy head. Aroma is quite malty with oak, toffee, grain and some notes of spice and juniper, as well as some hoppy apricots. Full body with very soft carbonation. Flavour is roasted malts with notes of bread, as well as kandi, vanilla, perfume and flowers, and some hoppy orange peel. Long balanced finish.

On tap at the brewpub - Pours hazy golden with a white head. The aroma has candi sugar, light spice and Belgium abbey yeast. It has a full rich body with semi-soft carbonation and is pretty smooth. The flavor starts off very sweet with light toast and a bit of spice, pepper and a ribbony caramel trait. Nicely done.

I agree with the previous comments about batch 92. Unfortunately, not up to the standards of this great brewery. Flat. Boozy. Suspended floating particles. The honey at the end was the only redemption.

12oz batch 93 in Chapeau glass. Viscid pour of turbid amber with negligible foam. Cigar box, lavender, maple sugar, and leaf litter aromas. Heavy-handed doses of sweet and tannic bitter fight for dominance with no bubbles to referee. This is not ready.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2014 Appearance is cloudy golden. Aroma is hops and mild tang of the rye. Lingering bitterness, spice and fruitiness and very syrupy sweetness. Nice but dont know if I could drink a lot nor want to.

Draft at the brewery. Hazy golden color. Full head. Candy sugar, Belgium yeast spice. Dry finish. Average carbonation. Spicey finish. Excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Hair of the Dog, Portland, OR

Pours dark orange with a smooth head. Aroma of ripe fruits, yeast, malts, sweet sugar and honey. Taste is smooth, malty, sweetish and ripe fruity with some sugar and honey notes. Finish is smooth and ripe fruity. Quite balanced and tasty.

Bottle as an extra from Homer321. A long time want. Killing me with these! Thanks bud. Batch 92 poured on May 24, 2014. Pours murky orange colored with no head at all. A bit ugly. Huge sweet aroma of malt, some old citrus grapefruit hops, honey, caramel, smells soooo sweet. Flavor follows with a citrus honeycomb flavor, very sweet, lemon rind notes, caramel. Seems to be a lot going on here but verging on cloying. Syrupy thick mouthfeel with no carbonation. Totally flat. Ive had Fred from the Wood, and I think the wood aging helps makes this a bit more drinkable. A definite sipper. Honestly this is better than the score I gave it overall. Very glad I got to try it!

12 ounce bottle (Batch 92) poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Pours a hazy honey orange with hardly any off-white head, bits of sediment throughout. Looks flat as no head formed other than a small cluster on one corner. Aromas of caramel, candied and dark fruit, toffee. Tasting notes of caramel, dark fruit, brown sugar, light floral hops. Light body with a dry finish. Booze is mostly hidden. Thin mouthfeel, definitely flat. Had Batch 89 in November and that was noticeably better.

On tap.

A: Cloudy orange with a pleasantly fluffy white head.

N: Nice hop bill. Earth and pine, a touch of pineapple and orange. Taffy, toffee, and buttery cracker. 

T: Leaning toward the bitter. Malt adds a soft sweetness.

M: A trace of alcohol burn. Warm and sticky. Medium heavy body.

O: A good batch. Shows Alans deftness of hand, and stands out from the crowd.

12oz bottle pours completely flat, no head or bubbles, hazy semi clear toasted orange. Nose is sweet malty caramel, yeasty fruit, raisin, maple. Taste is maple syrup, yeasty fruit, bready caramel, sweet, boozy. Syrupy slimy mouthfeel. Finish is boozy maple, dough, caramel, apple, overly sweet. Not very good. Maybe this was a bad batch (92)? This bottle was harsh.
12oz bottle pours a hazy pale brown color with some yeast flocculates. Very sweet with some fruitiness and some pepper. This bottle was a little on the flat side.

On tap at the brewery. 
Pours a gold amber with light head.
Aromas of fruit candy.
Flavours of candy and sharp rye, with some alcohol in the end.

Also had Fred Batch 34 2000 from a 12 oz bottle.
Poured a garnet red brown with little head.
Aromas of toffee and toasted malt.
Flavours of red liquorice, and candy sugar. Still somewhat sweet. Very different from the current vintage. Excellent.
9/4/9/4/17

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2014 Batch 90 poured from bottle to snifter. Golden hue with pillowy white head that lingers. Aroma is huge malt, toffee, sugar, vanilla, citrus, honey, graham cracker. Mouthfeel is fantastic with a full body and great carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout but not cloying with a nice slight bitterness in the following and CO2 & ethanol rounding out the finish. Overall this is a really nice brew! It is very fruity from the hops when fresh. I can see it aging very well with the malt backbone.

Batch 93 poured from bottle to glass. Golden hue with no head and yeast particles in suspension. Aroma is malt, honey, sugar, ethanol. Mouthfeel is decent with a full body but no carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout with a slight bitter following and ethanol finish. Overall this is a decent batch considering that its still.

bottled 12/09. thanks wes. slightly hazy light copper with a small white head. raw comb honey, pineapple, some caramel aroma. flavor of black licorice, burnt sugar, honey, anise. still warming. full bodied and quite sweet. fresh would be interesting as well.

Purchased at Wallys in Los Angeles, CA; enjoyed while watching True Detective after a long day of venturing. Appearance is a bright cloudy gold with a large bubbly white head. Aroma is pretty light, with interesting floral notes. Taste is unique, large tropical fruit profile with sweet syrupy malt notes. Its 10% ABV and masks it pretty well. Good stuff.

This is an awesome barley wine. pours a dirty sediment ridden marmalade color with a ton of soft foamy white head. The aromas coming off this are dizzying. Massive caramel at first, then sweet over ripe citrus. A bit of mango and papaya as well. Flavors are sweet and malty.. Vanilla, grand marnier, citrus, caramel.. and all things good. Finishes warm and boozy. A first rate barley wine.
Very good beer, but a little alcohol forward for the style. And I hardly ever think that...

Nice brown sugar and slight citrus aroma. Bitter but sugary balanced taste. Overall very good beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at brewery. Golden pour with half a finger of white head. Grape, apple, sugar cane. Full body and sweet finish. Awesome

Pours golden-brown and cloudy with a thick light tan head. Aroma is a nice balanced blend of hops and malts. Taste is exactly the same. The hops and maple syrup flavors lead quickly to some rye inspired malts that then slides into a long bitter finish. Overall, it is rustic and very flavorful.

Clear amber color, almost no lacing at all. Subtle aroma of sugarcane, grape, pear, brown sugar, damp pine needles, and rich loam. Dry, tannic bitterness with a surprising depth of flavor. Smooth and medium-bodied with a lingering bitter finish. Mild to moderate booziness

Pours bronze around the outside with a deep orange center and a large cream colored head. The aroma is citrus, orange juice, tangerine, and sweet sugar with a touch of pine.  The taste is clean and hoppy initially with a spicey kick on the back end. The malts really shine on this one and create balance all around. The palate varies from light and clean at times to medium with a sugary candy coating. The carbonation is high. Excellent and complex all around without being overwhelming - total balance.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 fl.oz. bottle   Meine Flasche sagt "Batch 77". Voluminöse Schaumentwicklung. Orange-trüb-matschig im Glas. 
Toller zitrus-hopfiger Geruch. 
Der Antrunk ist sehr süß-klebrig, voluminös, frisch-herb. 
Zum Hauptteil wird das Bier noch etwas dickflüssiger, mild, hefig, leicht nach gelben Früchten, überreif. Dazu die omnipräsente alkoholische-scharfe Note. 
Der Nachgeschmack ist lang, alkoholisch-scharf, süß-klebrig-dickflüssig. 
--> interessantes Bier. Für meinen Geschmack aber viel zu klebrig-süß und zu alkoholisch-scharf. Das geht bei 10% auch besser!

 
Test vom 21.2.2011, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,7,6,7,12,7 - 7,60

12 oz bottle shared by Kevin among a few folks at Beachwood BBQ in Seal Beach. Poured into a taster. Brown-orange in appearance with a few floaties despite a careful pour. A two-plus finger head forms, stays for a while, then leaves spots of lacing as it recedes. Aroma is caramel, vanilla, alcohol, dried pears, and apples. Taste, initially, is moderate sweetness with caramelized sugar and dried fruit notes. On the finish there is a citrus hop flavor, rye spiciness, and alcohol. Full body, thick, chewy, sticky texture, soft carbonation in the mouth which is strange after the bubble show on the pour, and a finish that is initially abruptly bitter and has a warming boozy tail.

Pours a amber out of bottle with a big creamy head. Aromas of citrus, malt and brown sugar. Taste is sweet malt and brown sugar with an assertive bitterness. Creamy and full body with medium carbonation. Very drinkable. Thanks Rob!

Batch 85. 1/8/14. Pours a beautiful ruby dark orange amber. Amazing, large frothy creamy tan head, fully lasting with thick lace. Seems very fresh. Very aromatic. Aroma is rich, malty and hoppy, as I the flavor. Fruity, super ripe citrus, bit of pine, sugar, caramel. Just a touch of alcohol. Fantastic balance. Complex but not complicated. Perfectly moderate bitterness and just sweet enough to balance. Creamy, luscious, and smooth. Exceptional, and doesnt have to be huge to do it..
Fairly light color for a barleywine, and lots of carbonation, looks and feels more like a saison, but full-bodied and strong, slightly medicinal. The flavor really explodes as soon as you take a sip.
Poured dead flat. Beautiful golden color zero head. Smells great and of sweet date. Its good but with carbonation it could be great. Beer is good , carbonated beer is better .

12 oz bottle courtesy of Chris, served in a stem glass next to Fred from the Wood. Pours hazy caramel with a small, rocky tan head that fades to a thin rim and leaves no lace. The nose has huge notes of sugar cane, rum and fruit, along with molasses, dark fruit and just a touch of hops. The flavour is rich and sweet, with complex molasses, cane and dark fruit paired with subtle spice and delicate hops. The finish is long and malty with complex cane and molasses with a touch of hops. On the palate it is full in body with a smooth, syrupy texture and minimal carbonation. Overall, this is a great barley wine; it is incredibly complex with beautiful malts and just the right amount of hops. Beautiful. 2014-01-04

On draught at Hair of the Dog. Deep golden color. Sweet aroma of grape, caramel, and sugar, with some grassy hop notes. Taste is candi sugar, grape, rye liqueur, and grassy hops. Opens up and sweetens as it warms. Mellow for 10%.

Pretty amazing. Sweet and grainy aroma with a touch of hops bitterness. Copper-like color with a small head. Smooth palate with some weight. This barley wine knows what it is supposed to be without leaning too much to the hoppy side or the sweet. Caramel notes with wood and hops to balance. Remarkable.
1/15/2012. On tap at the brewery in Portland. Light orange color with a white head. Malty and boozy aromas with light fruit and plenty of hops. Sweet and boozy flavors. Very good.

Batch 80

A: Pours golden and lifts a fine white less than single finger head which thins to a sheet of the same. Slightly hazy. 

S: Sweet grains. Apple skins (too bad). Floral, citrus, vitamin scents here as well.

T: Sweet, alcoholic, phenolic. Not real hop feel here. Woody tones.

M: Syrupy, heavy, moderate carbonation. Coats the mouth and remains resonate.

D: Ones enough for me. Too sweet.

Serving type: bottle

02-26-2011
12oz bottle pours a golden amber with a very large tan head that never leaves. Toffee, sweet malt and spice taste.
Tap at Hair of the Dog, Portland. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Malts, sweetness, fruits and hops.
Excellent barleywine. Very sweet, but without feeling like a 4,000 calorie malt-bomb. Hints of apricot or some such dried fruit. A nice way to get 10% into you.

12 oz bottle. Pours a rich golden color with 3 fingers of head. Good lacing and head retention. Great malt/hop smell of this one. Sweet almost carmel taste that finishes with some great hop tones. Well balanced all around with no noticable booziness. Great barleywine.

Pours a hazy golden orange from the 2012 bottle with thin ring of bubbly head. Aroma is lots of caramel, slight booze, a hint of spiciness. Taste is caramel, definitely some rye spice, slight bitter hoppiness is still there. No booze in the taste, just a hint of burn on the way down; very good for a barley wine.

A big boy beer, with a lot of potential. I gave this beer a first look at an early age. Highly complex, a bit rough on the palate, with obvious craftsmanship in the details. Will surely revisit in 9-12 months.

A: Hazy Golden Straw/Mild Amber Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Mild Lacing

S: Boozy, Mild Belgian Sugar, Mild Honey

T: Honey, Boozy, Mild Belgian Sugar

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mild Boozy

Overall, nice balance of booze and honey...sweet but over bearing.

Well carbonated, leaves light lacing on glass. The color is orange/gold. Smells of malt, fruity yeast, slightly of alcohol. Taste is very smooth. Very balanced, you can taste the alcohol but the malt and subtle hops mellow it out and make it a very good beer. Definately easy to drink for the alcohol content. Mmmmm

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Belch. Another turd from HOTD. Pours decidedly flat. Zero carbonation. Lifeless. Looks like sewer water. Aromas of malt, malt and more malt. Taste is watery dumpster juice. Finishes on a malty note of ass crack juice. No.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass; Batch 79 bottled 1/21/2010. Pours moderately cloudy bright orange amber color with a 1-2 finger dense off white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of big peach, pear, apple, pineapple, apricot, golden raisin, floral, grass, light pine, herbal, bread, rye, honey, light caramel, and floral earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of hop and malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big pineapple, peach, pear, apple, apricot, golden raisin, floral, grass, light pine, honey, rye, biscuit, caramel, toffee, herbal, and floral earthiness. Minimal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of pineapple, peach, apple, pear, apricot, golden raisin, floral, grass, honey, rye, biscuit, caramel, toffee, herbal, and floral earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of hop and light malt flavors; with a great moderately crisp hop/malt balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a slick, lightly syrupy, and fairly crisp mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is a highly excellent blond barleywine! All around great complexity, balance, and robustness of hop and malt flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2014 Pours a dark apricot from the bottle. Almost no head at all. Almost no carbonation. (Tried again from Batch 90 with a big foamy head and perfect carbonation.) Smells fruity and sweet. Flavors rich and fruity, sweet, but with noticeable bitterness. Inconsistent head, lacing, and carbonation, but when its right, its OH, So Good!

12oz to snifter. Murky light orange appearance. My bottle poured with zero head, and only had a slight carbonation bite on the palate. Thought it strange after reading other ratings and would have liked a bit more. The taste is very complex. Lots of sweet malts, fruits, hop character. It changes by the second after you sip. Syrupy palate. Very complex and delicious.

bottle from mathieuc, thanks bro. pours hazy and bright golden with a frothy and creamy white head, excellent retention and strong lacing. toasted belgian fruity malts, but also pils, bread and complex caramel,  fruitiness - pale that is, peaches, bit of herbs, celery, golden candi, very spicy, hint of tobacco, fruity coconut water, warming alcohol, some sweetness. moderate but constant carbonation - belgian-esque, medium body - oily and bubbly, bold chalky-grassy-peppery-spicy finish. loved it!

Batch 81 - Slightly hazy, slightly dark golden pour with a big white head. Malt and hop nose. Hop bitterness and lovely malt backbone. Mouthfeel is really nice, just thick enough to let you know this is a beer to be savored. This is a special ale an american barley wine classic.
Bottle shared by Homer321. Pours a clear dark golden color. Sweet malt aroma. Flavor of maple syrup, malt, some dark fruit.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2013 Bottle thanks to bytemesis. Thick honey and molasses. Slightly spicey. Chewy. Grate. 

---Rated via intercellular device
Hazy Plum, lots of licorice and tobacco on the nose. Taste is sweet, big and bold with english malt qualities. a touch of rye and oak with a caramel sweet finish. Very interesting.

355ml bottle. Courtesy of Urbain from Struise. MAalty, caramel, liquor and nuts aromas. Pours hazy dark gold, with frothy white head, persistent, good lacing. Medium to full body, rich texture, soft carbonation. Taste is smooth, sweet, malty, caramel, some raisins, very well balanced and pleasant. Really enjoyable.
Had on tap while on vacation in Seattle. May be the best beer I had the whole trip. A darker cloudy color. Hints compared to a stronger apple cider. One of the best sippers Ive had.

Bottle pour a few months back. This was my first HOTD and I was blown away. At the time my favorite barleywine with creamy, hoppy notes that were very alive. I was also impressed with the appearance; a very bold unique redish color.
Bottle. Hazy gold with a thin white head. Aroma is piney and citrusy hops. Taste follows suit and adds a peach note. Smooth and full palate. Nice.
Draft at HOTD, Portland. Pours a medium golden color, little to no head. Aroma sweet and caramel forward. Body medium, finish is boozy and long lasting.

[bottle]
Sweet, sugary aroma with a smooth, aged sherry character and grain. Almost clear, orange-amber under a persistent, shiny, off-white blanket. Smooth and slightly alcoholic flavour with a harmonious balance of sweet, herbal, and citrusy hops with sweet caramel and assertive bitterness. Extremely smooth and drinkable. Citrusy finish, medium to full body, smooth.

2010 batch 79 bottle to a tulip glass. Pours a thick, slightly hazy orangish brown with a one finger off-white head. Good legs, sticky lacing. Aroma is molasses, peach, yeast and malt. Taste is molasses, grapefruit, bread, little caramel and alcohol as well as a finishing flavor somewhere between oak and toasty. Not much bitterness. Velvety,full mouthfeel with a little alcohol warmth. Closer to an English Barlywine than an American one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle cheers to DoctorB2B. Pours hazy golden with a big, thick and foamy white head which lasts for the duration and leaves superb lacing. Nose is full of a huge amount of honey - massive honey followed by touches of vanilla, cranberry, raisin and caramel. Dried fruit focus. Almost maple syrup like. Taste shows incredible balance for such a big beer. Maple and honey mix with dried apricot and raisin, touch of toffee coming through. No heat at all. Drinks fantastically. Very, very good

A muddy hazy light brown with a hint of ruby and dark orange, finger of white head. Smells of Belgian yeast, vanilla, caramel, alcohol, brown sugar, an oak like funk. A big bold taste, alcohol apparent, sweet and oak up front, caramel malt, brown sugar, finishes fairly smooth, very little hop bitter. A bit too much of the woody flavors for me, and the alcohol is a bit overpowering as well. Overall a decent sipper but I was expecting more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: DEC 4, 2014 Bottle, orange pour, white head, nose is caramel, taste is caramel, super sweet and boozy
Aroma of maple, apricot and toffee. Pours hazy golden with good carb but no head. Taste is spiced rum, maple candy and brown sugar. Way too much booze taste. curious if this ages well.
Alkoholisch malziger Antrunk, hell, etwas hopfig. Gleichzeitig holzig, wenig herb. Süß getreidig, die Alkoholigkeit bleibt bestehen. Kräuternoten, unsüffig. 12/9/7/9/11/10

On tap at Hair of the Dog. Hazy amber with no head. Fruity aroma with something else I cant put my finger on. Taste is spicy with sweet grains, and again that weird flavour I cant put my finger on... sorry. Good overall.

Ce qui me frappe, cest labsence totale de mousse au-dessus de ce liquide blond-ambré et opaque. Avec détermination, on réussi à en provoquer. Au nez, une impression de sauce à mets asiatiques, un Phad Thaï par exemple. Ça sent le sucre et lacidité, mais aussi les abricots, la marmelade, la pelure dorange, les citrons confits et le sirop dérable. Un goût évolutif. Ça part doucement avec des saveurs de miel, dagrumes et dalcool et ça se termine dans un crescendo gustatif assez intense, où toutes les saveurs sunissent pour en former dautres et par-dessus tout ça, une amertume qui engourdit les mâchoires. Quelle expérience quand même. (Batch 88) (732-080713)

This bottle was not ordered from Craft Shack, yet it arrived with my order. I wasnt going to ask questions, I just accepted it as truth. I now had this wale in my possession. It begged to be treated with respect, to be held in the highest regard. It went straight into the fridge. It would wait, but I hoped it would not be long. My brother brought one of these back from the West Coast for himself. I was jealous. Now we were even. 
The bottle waited as I tested my patience. But today the day came. 800th rating. Out of the fridge it came.
The cap was popped with little regard for a gross display of carbonation. This beer felt no need for pomp. Into the goblet it poured. Deep amber, no head. Almost syrupy. The aroma is astounding. Fruits, both stone and citrus, combined with brown sugar. The taste is thick and hearty. Warming, but crisp. There is a pleasant hoppy bite. The balance of flavor is almost inconceivable. 
I do think I will sip on this one for awhile.

bottle by belgbeergeek , thnx dude ! 2008/2009 vintage . 
pours amber, almost no foam . smell is sweet, grainy 
taste is sweet, very balanced, doft and very gentle . not to much hops left due to the age
I had this beer on my oregon vacation a few weeks back. I didnt write down tasting notes, just an overall score, so here it is.

Bottle, batch 83. Pours a mostly clear golden amber with a huuuge lasting cream head. Aroma is sweet, fruity; Belgian yeast, caramel, spice, toasted grain, tropical fruit, citrus...very complex. Taste is medium-heavy sweet, light bitter, a little alcohol as well. The rye is certainly there. Finish is sweet and alcoholic. Full bodied, well carbonated. Somewhere between a barley wine and a Belgian Strong, very well done.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2016 A very nice strong Belgian. Pours a thick orange with a white head. Smells fruity. Taste is entirely different, malty, with lots of candy sugar, very interesting and tasty. Finishes pretty boozy. Had on tap at the brewery. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance was clear reddish black with diminishing tiny beige head, spotty lacing at best. Aromas are complex mixed of rich deep fruits, molasses, toffee, wood with hints of alcohol. Taste are caramel, English toffee, candi, raisin, fig, oak, date, all spice with warming alcohol. Palate was soft flat creamy CO2 with full rich body, then lasting deep fruity sweet woody alcoholic finish. If he finish wasnt so alcoholic it would be stellar.
Pours a hazy amber with no head whatsoever. Very still beer, not much carbonation at all. Aroma is fruity, caramel, bread. Taste is sweet belgian candy, yeast, caramel, booze. Good stuff!

Shared 12 oz. bottle. Not sure of the age. Poured to snifters with a hazed, orangy amber hue, no noticeable legs, a modest amount of light tan head foam that quickly diminished to a thin ring & film, and spotty lacing. The nose was immediately malty sweet, but typically barleywine-ish, boozy, with notes of caramel, apple, and spice. Syrupy textured, less than full bodied, with not much carbonation to speak of. Moderately hop bitter, and definitely warming, but surprisingly quaffable. Might have missed this bottles heyday.

bottle from texas santa shared with ba merc. pors mahogany brown with a silkey cream colored head. nose is abundant with dark fruits. theme continues in the mouth with some caramel and toast. body is burly but silky smooth.

Another solid Hair of the Dog beer. Cloudy copper pour with nary a head. Sweet malt aroma. Mouthfeel is syrupy, which I don't usually like, but it works here. Boozy, which I don't usually like, but also works here. Flavor is quite sweet, toffee-esque, with a hint of Barleywine going on. Bigfoot on steroids in a good way. Recommended! A-

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a very cloudy light brown color with a moderate light tan head on it. Nose immediately hits you with some banana notes and some subtle cloves, but then settles down into some more earthy alcohol aromas. Taste is also a bit earthy and almost gritty, with some little bitterness and a bit of alcohol.

On tap at brewery. Honey gold with little to no cap, same rimjob edging. Aroma is rye forward, followed with honey, yeast, peach, young apricot. Taste is sweet bread, ripe apricot, hoppy bite. Lingering dry finish.
Hazy golden pour with a thin head.  Full mouth with lots of grain.  Long sweet candy finish. Sugary and sweet, but very drinkable for a 10% ABV.

Appearance:
Hazy oranges under a thick puffy white head which takes its time fading into a solid layer of white fluff, tightly packed white fluff that is. Swirls thick and lacy.

Nose:
Yeasty, doughy, spicy, and boozy. Apricots, peaches, and pineapples  dried and delicious. Green banana peel and aloe. Soft brushed saddlebags and chamois. Starfruit and papaya. Angel food cake soaked in all the above.

Palate:
Sweet and bready and chamois and bananas and nutty. Moist banana nut bread. Candied pineapple and apricot and apple. Cumin and saffron. Candied ginger in the back. Gentle warmth settles into the chest. Flambéed tropical undertones. A touch of angel food cake to soak up all the goodness.

Final Thoughts:
A sophisticated brew from a tongue in cheek brewery whose beers are anything but tongue in cheek. Hair of the Dog beers are hard to come by so should you ever be so lucky, enjoy. I know I did.

(An original written work by Beer Ambassador, LLC. Plagiarism is not tolerated.)

Poured into a perfect pint. Batch 83.

3.5 A: I needed a few pours to get a full glass due to the massive head. Anyway, I eventually got to a well hazed orange brown color with a lot of small particulate floating about. Three fingers of frothy/foamy beige head. Retention is impressive given the ABV and a ton of lacing is left.

4.5 S: Quite a nice nose on this. Quite malty like most HOTD brews. Deep caramel, toffee, light fruits, spicy earthy rye, and some raisin and fig. Candi sugar for that extra push of sweetness. Hops are floral, citrusy, and herbal. Solid, robust aroma on this.

4.0 T: Taste is like the nose, but just isnt quite as impressive. That said, its still damn good. Lots of caramel, generic light fruitiness, dates and raisins, spicy earthy rye. Again that trademark candi sugar residue. Mild bitterness, but much more hop flavor. Citrusy, then floral, then herbal, then citrusy again.

4.0 M: Heavier body. Good moderate carbonation despite needing several pours. Good creaminess and plenty smooth. Alcohol is hard to detect.

4.5 D: This might be my favorite HOTD brew. Very nice balance and super easy to drink. Well done.

Serving type: bottle

11-16-2012 04:49:38

Bottle courtesy of Porcelainbomb (reddit trader). Pours dark orange and gold with zero carbonation. Aromas are sweet sugary goodness, apricot, caramel and soap. Flavors are big sweet candy, then alcohol both burn and flavor, then something that tastes akin to carrot juice and finally some intense hop bitterness. Palate is very heavy in weight but a little thin and hot, it would benefit from some carbonation. Overall, this is a good beer though it is hard to wrap my head around all the flavors and feelings this is trying to convey to the drinker; it is a little too broad in flavor which causes it to become muddled. Still above average due to its scope and the fact that not many brewers would take this kind of a chance.

12 oz. cellared bottle from 2008.

Poured amber and more-or-less clear.  Although bottle conditioned, the aromatics seem similar to a barrel-aged beer.  Some of that is the suggestion of brandy in this high ABV ale. Also smells a little fruity. Has a medium-full body with some harshness from the alcohol.
Taste: very strong flavor; no style on bottle but "imperial barleywine" seems appropriate.  Mildly bitter. 

O: an extreme ale that seems a little over the top and with the high ABV a bit too obvious.  Rough and unrefined in contrast with an aged Firestone DBA that preceded it.

12oz bottle of batch 78 (drinking with Conflux 1, The Dissident, and Adam) pours a cloudy orange and gold with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, brown sugar oranges Taste similar to aroma with rye malts, sweet, with some lingering hop bitterness of the finish. Very nice and easy to drink for 10%. Pretty awesome Barley Wine.
Bottle from International Trade; hazy amber pour with frothy white head, peachy and alcohol aroma, quite floral taste peach sweet, can feel the ABV.

Bottle to glass.  Thickes head ive ever seen.  Took a good 10 min to receed.  Has a bit of candied sugar to it but less than the typical barleywine.  A bit spicy and can taste the alcohol.   Its like a golden ale just 3 times stronger.  Decent but dont see the biig deal.

Tap @ HOTD. Dark amber, with thin head. Aroma of malt, over ripe fruit and some alcohol.
Taste is complex with caramel, spice and some alcohol warmth balanced with some bitterness

Pours murky orange with a thickcwhite head. Aroma is sweet malt, brown sugar, toffee, dark fruit, brown sugar, and molasses. Taste is brown sugar, toffee, cane syrup, caramel covered apples, and some booziness. Finishes bitter with medium to high carbonation.

355ml bottle. Clear golden colour with average to huge, firm, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Intense heavy malty aroma, hoppy counterweight, a strawy touch. Taste is sweet malty, hoppy counterweight again; warming, slightly biting alcohol in the finish; sticky palate. Intense, balanced of course, but simply not my taste.
Back log. Enjoyed at a tasting with some local beer buddies 2 weeks ago. Batch #73. Fantastic Barley Wine. Caramel/Brown sugar on the palate. Love this brew.

Bottle, batch 81, consumed 4/16/2013.  Pours hazy golden with dense, creamy white head, all kinds of lacing.  Aroma is caramel, bread, cardboard, citrus, spice, grass, and vinous notes as well.  Thick, viscous, syrupy texture.  Lively carbonation, full body.  Taste of honey, caramel -- lots of sweetness here.  Some spiciness, a shade of oxidation (or whatever the hell that taste is I think is oxidation in aged beer, anyway).  Warming alcohol.  Anise.  Nice bitterness in the finish -- muted, but just right to cut the sweetness of the rest.  Overall:  Extremely sweet.  Almost too much (but not quite).  Delicious beer, one to which I keep returning.  8/4/8/4/16
UPDATED: APR 18, 2013 Very balanced, lots of carbonation. Its a great barley wine with a lot of complex, light flavors.

2009 version. Pours from the bottle a deep ruby red color with a tall, frothy light tan head. Aroma is extremely complex with a huge malt profile, Merlot nose with a slight smokey, rye spiciness. Hops adds some citrus, grassy and pine character to the beer. Flavor is very smooth with a lot of residual sweetness. The rye lends a strong character to this brew and melds well with the citrus, grassy and pine hops character of the beer. Body is hefty with a low amount of carbonation that really makes it feel sugary and thick. Overall a very good brew. The age is starting to creep a bit into the flavor. Sweetness is a bit much for me but doesnt detract from the flavor as the rye spice and very light smoke help to take the edge off of it. If Brachs candy made a beer candy, this is what I hope they would aim to get.

On draught at HOTD - thin head that quickly dissipates.  Sweet boozy nose.  Taste of boozy brown sugar with hoppy dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2017 Pours hazy amber with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of caramel, ripe apple, raisins, toffee, butterscotch. Taste is lots of caramel with a lot of marinated tropical fruit. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
12oz bottle courtesy of mcberko, Thanks! good solid barley wine a solid choice in the style, nailing all the highlights.. really tasty

Pours cloudy, floatie-filled orange-brown with a gushing, off-white head.
Aroma is rye malt, caramel..
Taste is tart/sour fruit, candied and sticky....rye.
Hoppy with a slight alcohol/pepper bitter finish.
Hazy orange with a voluminous off  white head. Huge mango nose with a bit of pineapple. Sweet malt, tropical fruit, hop bitterness and alcohol dominate the flavor profile. Long bittersweet finish.

A: Gorgeous and original. Completely opaque golden orange with a foamy cream colored head that sticks around. 

S: Wow. Smells sticky with resin, caramel and pine sap. Huge citrus fruit notes and sweet, rich caramel.

T: Resinous pine, sweet butterscotch and toffee, sugared grapefruit peel and the Belgian candi sugar shines through. Slight rye spice dry notes throughout.

P: Sticky, chewy, full. Coats the mouth resiny sweetness.

O: Amazing.
On tap. Clear dark amber with a thin off white head. Scent is sugar and malts, pine? Taste is dark fruit, sugar, hops and rye.
Bottle from beer craft. Color dark copper with fluffy white head witch lingers. Aroma is sweet. Taste is bitter with hops at the beginning. Finish is dark fruits, tobacco
Pours with a huge head. Cloudy yellow orange. nice hope bitterness with a malty fruity aftertaste.

Bottle from Frank. Tasted right before Bourbon Fred. This is much better imo. Thanks to Carleton, Kevin and James for bottles. Cheers guys!
Reviewed from notes. Thick white head that recedes very slowly. A hazy golden amber appearance. Aroma a robust caramel, heavy malt with slight fruitiness. Reminiscent  of a Belgium.  Flavor begins with light malt, some citrus flavors followed by a significant fruity yeast flavor. Very sweet but some bitter counterbalance. Full body with more carbonation than expected. Easy to drink and unique creation.
Golden orange in color... Aroma light malt sugar.. Flavor is sweet and citrusy, Belgian yeast and candi sugar on the finish... Solid

From a 12 bottle shared at home.  Pours a hazy dark gold with a massive off white head.  Fresh yeasty aroma.  Flavors of tropical fruits, caramel and toffee with a significant hop overtone.  Slightly bitter finish.  Nice.

Bouteille 12oz, courtoisie de Hogtownharry ou Blankboy. De couleur ambrée-cuivrée et voilée. Nez de malt sucré du genre caramel sucré, fruité (abricots, pêches, agrumes, léger de pommes), de houblon  floral, herbeux et aux notes citriques, léger dalcool liquoreux et dépices (poivre). Ronde-moyenne en bouche avec un pétillement bas-moyen et une texture légèrement liquoreuse et crémeuse. Goût fruité sucré (agrumes, léger dabricots et de prunes vertes, notes de pêches et de pommes) avec un goût amer de houblon floral, légèrement citrique et aux notes terreuses (une amertume qui dure toute la gorgée) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût sucré de malt du genre caramel sucré avec des notes de caramel toffee et de sucre bonbon. Parallèlement, lon retrouve un goût réchauffant dalcool moyen-fort liquoreux jusquen finale accompagné dune amertume de houblon légèrement plus herbeuses et aux petites traces résineuses. Post-goût long et un peu asséchant, amer de houblon floral, légèrement herbeux et citriques et aux petites notes terreuses,  dalcool moyen avec un léger goût fruité (zeste dagrumes, pelures de pommes, noyau de pêche).
Aroma is lightly boozey with a ton of citrusy hops and a floral bouquet. Fresh fruit and caramel malts, too. Taste is bitter hops, some light alcohol, pine, peaches, and malt heavy. Good stuff.

12oz bottle shared by OmegaX
Appearance - Hazy yellow, messy lacing, decent carbonation
Aroma - Honey, hops, pound cake, pineapple sorbet 
Taste - Oranges, bready, hoppy and clean

This is a nice brew all around - a very sweet and hoppy barley wine with very little detection of alcohol.

Bottle. Thanks to Seth for providing this! The pours deep amber with a small off-white head. The aromas of thick, rich caramel. Sweet maple syrup. Spruce tree root. Full, malty aromas with a nice hop bitterness. The taste is strong woody hops. More spruce, pacific forest. Rich, chewy caramel and brown sugar. Light accents of smoked ham. Lightly bitter finish. Full body. A touch hot. This is a sipper indeed. Overall, this is a nice barleywine. The strong hop presence still comes through nicely in this bottle.

Pours foggy dark amber with yellow high frothy head. Lovely oaky, oily aromas. Loads of caramel malts. Some citrus tones. Bit of alcohol. Resin, apricots, peaches. Lovely!
Honey sweetness explodes, nice long bitterness, loads of tropical fruits. Medium bodied. Low carbonation. Alcohol. Should probably be drinken quite fast due to low carbonation. The most fruity BW ive had.
I want more from this famtastic brewery!

Pours cloudy dark amber with big off-white head. Aroma of peach, apricot, caramel malt, toffee, oak barrel. Very complex! Taste is very fruity sweet with loads and loads of tropical fruit and citrus hops, a very balanced bitterness that only gets richer towards the finish. Very boozy and long finish that warms to the bone. Body is medium with low carbonation, oily texture.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drank in pilsner glass from 12oz bottle. Aroma- citrus and rye scents. Appearance- murky/muddy orange. Tons of head and carbonation. Head did not dissapate. Taste- rye taste and boozy flavors. Not too alcoholic but its noticeable blended with the rye and citrus. Palate- strong alcoholic mouthfeel. Overall- not bad but definetely a bit boozier than expected for a golden ale.

Pours a deep golden color with a tall off white that dissipates reasonably quickly.  The nose is all fruit and honey.  the taste has some caramel undertones and some fruity accents.  Its tought to nail down the main taste but it does have a bit of a chalky feel to the palette.  A bit of a disclaimer this is from an older vintage and is my first round with this beer.  I wonder if somehing slightly fresher would have a different feel to me.  On the whole its a decent beer but the taste seems a bit confused as to what it should taste like.

Has some sweet caramel scents and taste, taste is a bit boozier with some decent fruit flavors.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Batch 83. Bottle. Pours a dark, hazy amber. Head is huge and sturdy, even with slow pour. Head is cream in color. Highly carbonated which is uncommon with the style. Aroma is hints of grapefruit, yeast, slight bananna. Taste starts sweet and ends with a serious hop kick. Taste much different than i expected. Hops are very present. More bitter than floral. Alcohol is very well hidden. Nice malt body holds up well to the hops. Resinous mouth coating. My first experience with this brewer. They obviously are interested in big, high quality craft brews. A nice selection. Seems like it would age well. Interested in trying more from these guys.

Batch 85, 12oz btl. Pours clear dark gold with dark sediment flakes. Aroma of pineapple, alcohol, big malt w/ hops underneath it all in the background.  Flavor is huge apricots, malt, not descript  US hops.  Has a full flavor without being too cloying w/ a bitter finish. Overall very good, a little unrefined, but thats this brewerys style it seem like.  Very Good!  rated by Alex  
hopsandvines.net

Good! Bottle pours a light to dark amber little hazy, good head good retention, sweet woodsy smell, taste sweet rich caramel, with that good flowery taste of HOTD, A very good Barley Wine a little over malty as for the sweetness but I like it alcoholic & sweet 10.0 ABV
